action.action-desc: Mr. Carter of Louisiana (for himself and Ms. Mace) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Education and Workforce

form.official-title: To amend the Richard B. Russell National School Lunch Act to require schools to offer a variety of milk to students participating in the school lunch program, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Freedom in School Cafeterias and Lunches Act or the FISCAL Act.

section.header: Types of milk offered under the school lunch program

subsection.text: Section 9(a)(2) of the Richard B. Russell National School Lunch Act (42 U.S.C. 1758(a)(2)) is amended—

paragraph.text: in the heading, by striking Fluid milk and inserting Milk;

clause.text: by striking fluid milk. Such milk and inserting milk, including fluid milk and plant-based milk, which;
by inserting or, in the case of a plant-based milk not included under those guidelines, consistent with nutritional standards established by the Secretary after (7 U.S.C. 5341); and
by inserting and after the semicolon;

subparagraph.text: in clause (ii), by striking ; and and inserting a period; and

paragraph.text: by redesignating subparagraph (C) as subparagraph (B); and
in subparagraph (B) (as so redesignated), in the matter preceding clause (i), by inserting or plant-based milk after fluid milk.
Section 14(f) of the Richard B. Russell National School Lunch Act (42 U.S.C. 1762a(f)) is amended, in the third sentence, by inserting or plant-based before milk.
Section 20(c) of the Richard B. Russell National School Lunch Act (42 U.S.C. 1769b(c)) is amended by striking fluid.
